00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements constant string values
00004 #    (Used for things like INFINITY, and so on)
00005 #
00006 package Parser::String;
00007 use strict; no strict "refs";
00008 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00009 
00010 $Parser::class->{String} = 'Parser::String';
00011 
00012 #
00013 #  Mark the created word as infinity or negative infinity, and so on.
00014 #
00015 sub new {
00016   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00017   my $equation = shift; my $strings = $equation->{context}{strings};
00018   my ($value, $ref) = @_;
00019   my $def = $strings->{$value};
00020   unless ($def) {
00021     $def = $strings->{uc($value)};
00022     $def = {} if $def->{caseSensitive} && $value ne uc($value);
00023   }
00024   $value = $def->{alias}, $def = $strings->{$value} while defined($def->{alias});
00025   my $str = bless {
00026     value => $value, type => $Value::Type{string}, isConstant => 1,
00027     def => $def, ref => $ref, equation => $equation,
00028   }, $class;
00029   $str->weaken;
00030   $str->{isInfinite} = 1 if ($def->{infinite});
00031   $str->{isInfinity} = 1 if ($def->{infinite} && !$def->{negative});
00032   $str->{isNegativeInfinity} = 1 if ($def->{infinite} && $def->{negative});
00033   return $str;
00034 }
00035 
00036 sub newInfinity {
00037   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift; my $value = shift;
00038   my $neg = ($value =~ s/^-//);
00039   $self = $self->new($equation,$value,@_);
00040   if ($neg) {$self->{isInfinity} = 0; $self->{isNegativeInfinity} = 1}
00041   return $self;
00042 }
00043 
00044 #
00045 #  Make a Value::String or Value::Infinity object
00046 #
00047 sub eval {
00048   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00049   return $self->Package("String")->make($context,$self->{value}) unless $self->{isInfinite};
00050   my $I = $self->Package("Infinity")->new($context);
00051   $I = $I->neg if $self->{isNegativeInfinity};
00052   return $I;
00053 }
00054 
00055 #
00056 #  Return the replacement string if there is one,
00057 #    or let Value handle it if we can, otherwise return the string
00058 #
00059 sub string {
00060   my $self = shift;
00061   return $self->{def}{string} if defined($self->{def}{string});
00062   my $value = $self->eval;
00063   return $value unless Value::isValue($value);
00064   return $value->string($self->{equation});
00065 }
00066 
00067 #
00068 #  Typeset the value in \rm
00069 #
00070 sub TeX {
00071   my $self = shift;
00072   return $self->{def}{TeX} if defined($self->{def}{TeX});
00073   my $value = $self->eval; $value =~ s/([ _])/\\$1/g;
00074   return '{\rm '.$value.'}' unless Value::isValue($value);
00075   return $value->TeX($self->{equation});
00076 }
00077 
00078 #
00079 #  Put the value in quotes
00080 #
00081 sub perl {
00082   my $self = shift;
00083   return $self->{def}{perl} if defined($self->{def}{perl});
00084   my $value = $self->eval;
00085   return "'".$value."'" unless Value::isValue($value);
00086   return $value->perl;
00087 }
